archimate:DataObject.name: Aggregate
archimate:DataObject.documentation:
An Aggregate is a collection of Information with very clear meaning for the business. For example, the aggregate "Customer" will provide holistic information about a customer such as the name or the ID, but also the customer agreements with the bank of the customer or the positions he maintains in the bank
An Aggregate is used to describe the information managed within a Domain (See Domain). For example, the “customer” aggregate models the information managed by the domain “customer”. A Domain may include several aggregates, but the principles is to include only one.
Each Aggregate have a single IT Owner in IT organization(s) (it may have one in Architecture and one in Development and one in operations, but never 2 in Architecture or 2 in Development or 2 in Operations)
Each Aggregate have a single Business Owner
Each Aggregate will have one or several Domain Experts (the guys that knows and can explain well the business to the IT)
The Information provided by an Aggregated is structured in Entities. For example, the "Customer" Aggregate can provide Customer Credit Rating information of the customer, or the customer positions
